Issues.Title: build(bazel): revert back to yarn 1.12.1 under Bazel to fix Windows file-in-use issues
Issues.Body:
It turns out the issues on Windows observed after https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/588:

```

ERROR: Source forest creation failed: C:/users/olivier/_bazel_olivier/fyuc5c3n/execroot/angular/external (Directory not empty)
```

were not due to vendored_yarn but due to yarn 1.13.0.

This reverts back to safety of yarn 1.12.1 until we can find the root cause and fix it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build(bazel): revert back to yarn 1.12.1 under Bazel to fix Windows file-in-use issues" (#29431)

Issues.Title: Stacks
Issues.Body:
- Adds a simple `Stack` implementation
- Uses said `Stack` in two spots where we were using a stack in `i18n`.
- Notice in [this commit](https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/3a5744771c9b42ebececede930369b5bbcd2b1cf) that it resolves a previously missed (minor) issue that we were leaving unused integers in a stack as we moved "down", but never actually "popped" the value.

### Goals

Since we're using stacks in a few places already, and we're looking at using a stack to track DOM insertion locations, adding a `Stack` type enables a few things:

1. We don't re-implement stacks over and over in different ways. No matter how simple they are.
2. As stacks _could_ have memory pressure implications, centralizing all of our stack use through one type will make tracking our stack usage throughout the codebase easier, and may help track down those issues when/if they arise.
3. Opportunity to build a little more safety into our stack usage.

NOTE: I typed the words "poop" and "pooped" instead of "pop" and "popped" about 20 times during the development of this PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Stacks" (#29429)

Issues.Title: "this" binding in template causes massive lag
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Maybe @angular/angular? ### Is this a regression? No idea. ### Description If you need to to pass a function to an angular component and the function has a this in it, then you need to "functionName.bind(this)" to it so that it will bind to the correct context and you can use the this in your function. However, this seems to cause massive lag issues in some cases. A temporary workaround I have found is to change the functions to arrow function variables since they don't have a separate this context and therefore do not need to be bound to this since it is handled automatically. However, I believe this to be just that, a workaround. It seems to indicate a bigger issue within Angular possibly having to do with change detection. Here is a link to a video showing the two stackblitz's below using @swimlane/ngx-charts library as the components that need the functions passed to them: https://youtu.be/oFjfBCJ9gpA ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction **Buggy version:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-charts-axistickformatting-buggy-version **Workaround version:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngx-charts-axistickformatting-fixed?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.6
Node: 10.15.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.2

@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.2

@angular/cdk                      7.3.4
@angular/cli                      7.3.6
@angular/material                 7.3.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.2
@schematics/angular               7.3.6
@schematics/update                0.13.6
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.28.4
**Anything else relevant?** There is an issues on the @swimlane/ngx-charts github which shows this happening to other people as well along with the temporary workaround, but I figured this might indicate a larger Angular issue and that I should submit it here. Issue/comment link: https://github.com/swimlane/ngx-charts/issues/261#issuecomment-392046199

Issues.Title: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError, ngForm inside ng-template or structural directives and bindings to this form outside of ngTemplate : change detection works incorrectly
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package (probably) `@angular/compiler`/`@angular/forms`/`@angular/common` ### Is this a regression? I am not sure. I have 7.2.7+ (also represented in 7.2.10). ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... What I have: I have some wrapper with ngForm directive on it. Inside of this block with ngForm I have another wrapper with *ngIf directive. I have 2 inputs: type text and type checkbox in some container with *ngIf. Input type=text is dynamically required. It is required when checkbox is checked and otherwise. Inside ngForm wrapper, but outside of *ngIf wrapper I have 2 buttons: one button is native HTML button and another button is native button wrapped into my custom component. This component contains only native HTML button and it has disabled binding on it. Disabled binding applies as disabled attribute binding to native HTML button in it. Both native button and custom component button have absolutely same `disabled` binding. Common logic: buttons must be disabled when form is invalid and they must be enabled when form is invalid. What I have: when I press checkbox form becomes invalid and native HTML button with disabled binding becomes disabled. But my custom button with disabled binding is not disabled. Also I have `ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError` error in console in dev mode. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [Stackblitz example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-2cpkeo) 1. Open example 2. Press checbox (set it to checked). Expect: 2 buttons disabled (accordingly to all bindings) + no errors in console. Fact: native HTML button disabled, but my custom control with disabled binding is not disabled + `ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError` error in console. Notice: after next change detection cycle everything will become ok (you can trigger it by clicking anywhere outside of controls in my demo). ## üî• Exception or Error 

ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'disabled: true'. Current value: 'disabled: false'.
+ visually state rendered incorrecly. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

7.2.7 (also can be reproduced at 7.2.10).
**Anything else relevant?** Thoughts about structural directives: Structural directives are compiled to `ng-template` with directives. We figured out that it is not problem with structural directives. Structural directives are copiled to ng-templates. I also added raw `ng-template` example to my tag. So it is not problem with ngIf/ngSwitch/ngForOf or any my project-specific structural directive. Looks like it is problem with `ng-template`. What I noticed: when I use `ng-template` when `@angular/compiler` creates `ngfactory` for my component for some reasons it create not 1 factory function but more functions. For some reasons `required` binding is in one factory, but buttons binding are in another factory (there are 2 "change detection" functions in each factory). So approximate flow is: 1. Call first "change detection" function from "first" ngfactory (with binding to native HTML button) 2. Call "change detection" function for required binding and change state of the form. 3. Call second "change detection" function from ngfactory from point 1 ("first" ngfactory). State of the form is changed in change detection cycle (at point 2) and when we reach point 3 we get another value from absolutely same binding. Because form state changed only at 2 point. About error in console: In dev mode we have special check. After real change detection we have one more cycle to check if any bindings change their values. So in 1 point we got different values for `disabled` expressions (because form state changed in 1 change detection cycle). Thats why we get this error. I can write more verbose if you need. Hope you understood me.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError, ngForm inside ng-template or structural directives and bindings to this form outside of ngTemplate : change detection works incorrectly" (#29421)

Issues.Title: ci: do not cache modified "node_modules" in "material-unit-tests" job
Issues.Body:
Fixes that the `material-unit-tests` job currently fails. This now
surfaces because yesterday we rebased the `ivy-2019` branch
which now contains a `postinstall` hook needed for Bazel.

Currently we cache the Material `node_modules` after
the `run_angular_material_unit_tests.sh` completed. This
means that the cache will incorrectly contain the Ivy NPM
package output which might be incompatible with the
other Material dependencies. e.g. the Material postinstall
command now uses a different NGC version that does not
work with the `typescript` version that has been specified in
the Material project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: do not cache modified "node_modules" in "material-unit-tests" job" (#29416)

Issues.Title: New feature to identify an element from X and Y coordinates
Issues.Body:
Hi, I would like to have a method in ElementRef.nativeElement to capture the dom elements present in the particular X and Y coordinates. In Javascript we have 
document.elementFromPoint(X, Y); // X and Y denotes the positions
In my application I planned to find the overlapping draggable elements on user action on any movable dom elements. Based on that i need to pass the information to an algorithm to find the next possible positions for that overlapping element
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New feature to identify an element from X and Y coordinates" (#29415)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ViewContainerRef.destroy should properly clean the DOM
Issues.Body:
Investigating an issue in one material example (FW-1171) showed that the DOM was not properly cleaned when using `ViewContainerRef.destroy()`. In particular:
- the comment for ng-container was not removed
- views of nested `ViewContainerRef` were not cleaned

The changes make the `walkTNodeTree()` even more complex, but it remains non recursive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): ViewContainerRef.destroy should properly clean the DOM" (#29414)

Issues.Title: Get list of all injected or injectable services of a module or component
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core/Injector


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
Ability to **get a list of all injectable services**.
I need to create a component or a service that could have access to all injectable services of an application without knowing all of them.
Currently the Injector provides only a **get** method and requires to know all services of all included modules (recursively) to achieve this.
The aim is to create an highly reusable code that could browse all injectable services, and filter the services that match a rule (for example that extends a common class). Then, for all those services, trigger a specific method.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Add a **getInjectableServiceList** method to Injector which would return a list of all injectable services. From this list we should be able to inject the service only if required.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Creating and maintaining manually a list of all the services used by an application.
But as this is intended to be used in over 20 apps whom all have different configuration, it would be very painful and error prone, so this is not a viable solution.
Using **multi** is also not possible as it would require that all services are injected into same "name" and it won't be anymore possible get one specific service by it's class name. It would be great if multi was able to return all injectable services that extends a particular class without changing injection everywhere.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Get list of all injected or injectable services of a module or component" (#29413)

Issues.Title: Call ng [serve | build] with a platform flag
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

It would be great to be able to add extensions to `ng serve` and `ng build`, which would allow me to call a custom serve/build mechanism.

This would be very useful with NativeScript where the developers need to use two CLIs, the Angular CLI for generating components, services etc. and the NativeScript to build and deploy the apps.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

When I am in a NativeScript Angular project (or a code-sharing project web+mobile), it would be great to be able to call something like:
`ng serve --ios` or `ng serve --flag=android`, which would then ask the architect on how to perform the build iOS or Android build and deploy the app.

It would also be great to do the same with `ng build --ios`, which would perform a full mobile build.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

What I am looking after is a mechanism that would allow me to plug into the Angular CLI, and then extend it with additional build options.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use `sass` instead of `node-sass`
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE: we no longer use `node-sass` by default, instead we use `sass` (dart-sass).

While in most cases this should not have an impact the generated code, dart sass has some differences from Ruby Sass. See https://github.com/sass/dart-sass#behavioral-differences-from-ruby-sass for more details

If you wish to use `node-sass` instead of `sass` you need to install node-sass as a dev dependency.

npm users
```
npm install node-sass --save-dev
```

yarn users
```
yarn add node-sass --dev
```


**Note**: for larger Sass projects to avoid this performance hit you might want to install `fibers`. See: https://www.npmjs.com/package/fibers


Ref: TOOL-748
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use `sass` instead of `node-sass`" (#13950)

Issues.Title: Support core-js@3.0.0
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
core-js 3.0.0 [is released](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/releases), but `ng serve` fails with error
```
ERROR in ./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/jit-polyfills.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'core-js/es7/reflect' in 'C:\Work\frontend\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\angular-cli-files\models'
```

With `core-js@3.0.0` it's `import 'core-js/proposals/reflect-metadata';`

Workaround: Add this to your tsconfig.json:
```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "paths": {
      "core-js/es7/reflect": ["node_modules/core-js/proposals/reflect-metadata"],
      "core-js/es6/*": ["node_modules/core-js/es/*"]
    }
  }
}
```

Issues.Title: `baseUrl` flag in protractors schema is deprecated
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

Please do not deprecate and remove the `baseUrl` flag in the protractor schema.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ x ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
In our CI/CD system, we run our e2e tests as a part of our pre-merge validations, which include deploying the SPA configured to run against our staging API. In order to do this cleanly, and without namespace conflicts/races, we give each of these applications their own base-href, as follows:

```
ng build
    --configuration=staging
    --output-path=./dist-e2e
    --base-href=/ci-cd-draft-build-${JOB_NUMBER}/
```

This is then uploaded to S3, and tested as follows:
```
ng e2e --baseUrl=https://<s3-bucket>/ci-cd-draft-build-${JOB_NUMBER}/
```
We also use these draft builds to perform Beta feature usability tests, product demos, and a variety of other activities that are greatly enhanced by having a fully functioning UI. Similarly, we publish whitelabel UI's for our customers, which we also run protractor-driven acceptance tests against, and whose base-url's vary greatly.

Just now, I noticed this message:
```
Option "baseUrl" is deprecated: Use "baseUrl" in the Protractor config file instead.
```
Which I traced to the following entry in the protractor schematic.
```
    "baseUrl": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Base URL for protractor to connect to.",
      "x-deprecated": "Use \"baseUrl\" in the Protractor config file instead."
    }
```
As our `buildUrl` value is not known ahead of time, we cannot easily use the protractor config file; while we could attempt to inject it via some form of environment parameter, modifying environment parameters is more cumbersome than adding a commandline flag.

### Describe the solution you'd like
We do not want this flag to be removed. It's not harming anyone, why is it being removed?

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Writing a configuration file for CI/CD, for every customer, environment, and build target we have. This will litter our project with config files, and we'd really like to avoid that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`baseUrl` flag in protractors schema is deprecated" (#13952)

Issues.Title: feat(@ngtools/webpack): update `require` statements to work with webp‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ack raw-loader v2.

webpack raw-loader released a breaking change https://github.com/webpack-contrib/raw-loader/releases/tag/v2.0.0 and now they use ES Module export instead of CommonJS.

BREAKING CHANGE: we now support only raw-loader version 2+ as the emitted code has changed to support version 2 of the mentioned loader.

Before
```
Component({
    selector: 'app-root',
    template: require("!raw-loader!./app.component.html"),
    styles: [require("./app.component.css")]
})
```

Now
```
Component({
    selector: 'app-root',
    template: require("!raw-loader!./app.component.html").default,
    styles: [require("./app.component.css").default]
})
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@ngtools/webpack): update `require` statements to work with webp‚Ä¶" (#13949)

Issues.Title: ng add @nguniversal/express-engine doesn't work with lib
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [x] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? no ### Description running `ng add @nguniversal/express-engine --clientProject projectName` generates `tsconfig.server.json` which has `"baseUrl": "."` that broke the `paths` from the parent `tsconfig.json` the `paths` option is used when generating a library so that the project reads the complied code from dist and works normally ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Reproduction repo https://github.com/robertIsaac/ng-lib-ssr generated as followed ``` ng new lib-ssr // commit #1 initial commit cd lib-ssr // works fine from localhost:4200 ng add @nguniversal/express-engine --clientProject lib-ssr // commit #2 add ssr npm run build:ssr && npm run serve:ssr // works fine from localhost:4000 ng g library lib // commit #3 add lib ng b lib // build the library to start using it // import LibModule from app.module and use compoennt in app.compoennt // commit #4 "use lib component inside the project" npm start // works fine from lcoalhost:4200 and shows "lib works!" npm run build:ssr && npm run serve:ssr or just ng run lib-ssr:server:production // will throw the error ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR in src\app\app.module.ts(13,5): Error during template compile of 'AppModule'
  Could not resolve lib relative to [object Object]..
src/app/app.module.ts(5,25): error TS2307: Cannot find module 'lib'.
## üåç Your Environment 

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/


Angular CLI: 7.3.6
Node: 11.11.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.13.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.13.6
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.13.6
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.13.6

**Anything else relevant?** solving the problem is to edit `src/tsconfig.server.json` and remove `"baseUrl": "."` from `compilerOptions` or add ``` "paths": { "lib": [ "../dist/lib" ], "lib/*": [ "../dist/lib/*" ] } ``` to the `compilerOptions` but the latter refer to `lib-ssr/out-tsc` as tsc output so you may consider changing the `outDir` to `../dist/out-tsc/app-server` so that it refer `lib-ssr/dist/out-tsc` as it suppose to but i'm not sure if it will matter at all

Issues.Title: Support `import()` syntax for loadChildren in ViewEngine
Issues.Body:
This feature ONLY matches the format below:
```
loadChildren: () => import('IMPORT_STRING').then(m => m.EXPORT_NAME)
```

It will not match nor alter variations, for instance:
- not using arrow functions
- not using `m` as the module argument
- using `await` instead of `then`
- using a default export (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/11402)

The only parts that can change are the ones in caps: IMPORT_STRING and EXPORT_NAME.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Support `import()` syntax for loadChildren in ViewEngine" (#13948)

Issues.Title: Enable custom arguments in serve command
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [X] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
Hello, Can you please enable the custom arguments in ng serve command? I was able to pass extra args with 1.7.X builds but with new CLI versions I can't simply because CLI is very restrictive. 


### Describe the solution you'd like
Developers should be able to pass custom arguments to ng serve command. Classic example as follows. Our current project has so many API endpoints like DEV1, DEV2... SIT1, SIT2, SVP to PROD. So with previous NG CLI versions we had our custom proxy conf file which reads an argument like  endpoint and then proxy to the correct API endpoint. But with new limitation we are unable to do that.
E.g. 
`ng serve --ssl true --proxy-config proxy.conf.js --endpoint sit1`

proxy conf.

```
const ENDPOINTS = {
	local: {
		endpoint: 'https://localhost:9443',
		mockEam: true
	},
	dev1: {
		endpoint: 'https:/dev.test.com.au',
                autoRewrite: true,
                changeOrigin: true,
		proxy: false
	},
	sit1: {
		endpoint: 'https://dev.test.com.au',
                autoRewrite: true,
                changeOrigin: true,
                proxy: true
	},
	uat1: {
		endpoint: 'https://uat.test.com.au'
	},
	svp1: {
		endpoint: 'https://svp.test.com.au',
		proxy: true
	}
};
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Can't think of any alternatives other than modify the endpoint manually every time which is a poor developer experience.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable custom arguments in serve command" (#13937)

Issues.Title: SchemaValidationException errors cannot be confirmed with instanceof
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report
```
- [ ] bug report
- [x] feature request for Schematics
```
### Description
`InvalidInputOptions` and `SchemaValidationException` are difficult to catch due to https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/13965

A solution is outlined in https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/13965#issuecomment-278570200 which would enable us to catch `SchemaValidationExceptions` with the `instanceof` operator and write more robust/intuitive code.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Attempt to `instanceof schema.SchemaValidationException` an `InvalidInputOptions` exception, and bear witness to the falsey response.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "SchemaValidationException errors cannot be confirmed with instanceof" (#13931)

Issues.Title: Overlays behave erratically when applied to Tree Nodes using Virtual Scrolling
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Users should be able to utilize Virtual Scrolling with the Tree without worrying about other functionality breaking.

#### What is the current behavior?
When using Tooltips on Tree Nodes in combination with Virtual Scrolling, the Tooltips appear improperly without context.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Apply Virtual Scrolling to a Tree and then expose Tooltips on the Tree Node Definitions.

[Demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/simplified-material-tree-with-virtual-scroll-xkvghx?file=app%2Ftree-flat-overview-example.html) - Mousing over any of the items in the Flat Tree should display a Tool Tip containing the Node's name, seemingly randomly it does accurately display the name in the proper place, most of the time you're left with a small gray box.

Edit: I have updated the demo to include a behavior where clicking on the text of a node will display a Snack Bar containing the node's name. This is also appearing as a gray bar at the top of the screen in many situations. This seems to be related to overlays as a whole in this context.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Overlays behave erratically when applied to Tree Nodes using Virtual Scrolling " (#15550)

Issues.Title: [improvement] mat-slider label shape is too small.
Issues.Body:
The mat-slider label is really pretty. But in most cases the value does not fit the width.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35452565/54681634-2772be00-4b0d-11e9-8439-563d149ffd38.png)

Solutions:
- The width of the label should fit the content. Min-width is the current width, but should be expand if the text is greater. In most cases it's only a bit more pixels. About 4-5 characters? e.g. "1000" or "0.1km"
But the shape should not be stretched, because it looks ugly. A 3-patch (9-patch) object could help.
- Allow custom shapes. And / or add the option to have a pretty rectangle shape.
- ~~Adjust the font size. But maybe the user should have a magnifying glass.~~
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[improvement] mat-slider label shape is too small." (#15548)

document.elementFromPoint(X, Y); // X and Y denotes the positions

In my application I planned to find the overlapping draggable elements on user action on any movable dom elements. Based on that i need to pass the information to an algorithm to find the next possible positions for that overlapping element

Issues.Title: mat-dialog-close wrongly adds an aria-label when the button text content is bound rather than static
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When I have `<button mat-dialog-close>Submit</button>` in a template, I expect for the resulting HTML to be basically the same, and mat-dialog-close should not add an aria label to the button.

#### What is the current behavior?
`<button mat-dialog-close aria-label="Close dialog">Submit</button>`

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-j9paiz?file=app/dialog-overview-example-dialog.html

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Head.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This area was partly addressed in https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/11093 but has this remaining bug. A workaround is available (just set aria-label explicitly in addition to the inner content), but this is not ideal.

https://github.com/stevenyxu/material2/commit/66453094e69e806f6fb84b2c856baa1ad1c71118 demonstrates the bug in the form of a failing unit test. I tried to do a fix but couldn't quickly come up with a performant solution without more work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-dialog-close wrongly adds an aria-label when the button text content is bound rather than static" (#15542)

Issues.Title: External label (not mat-label) isn't triggering mat-select
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Click on label should trigger related input or button. This behavior occurs with 'for' attribute on label and same value of 'id' on input or button. This behavior is important in both, with accessibility and with mobile devices.
#### What is the current behavior?
Using an external label (not mat-label) related to mat-select with for and id not triggering mat-select because it's not button or input behind.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/external-label-with-mat-select?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular: 7.2.0
Material: 7.3.4
Cdk: 7.3.4
Typescript: 3.2.2
Browsers: All

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I think that the solution for this is also open the opportunity to use mat-select as directive, see this:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/external-label-with-mat-select-as-directive?file=src/app/app.component.ts
exactly like you did with mat-table:
https://stackblitz.com/angular/kkxxemgjpmk?file=app%2Ftable-basic-example.ts
maybe even you should consider change permanently mat-select to button behind in dom.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "External label (not mat-label) isn't triggering mat-select" (#15534)

Issues.Title: build: decrease karma timeouts for local browsers
Issues.Body:
Currently the timeouts which have been adjusted for a
flaky browser connection are also used for local browser
runs. This is problematic as local browsers which do
not capture properly still wait multiple minutes, while the
browser can just be restarted without hitting any rate
limit.

Additionally removes the custom `FirefoxHeadless` browser
because the `karma-firefox-launcher` also provides the
`FirefoxHeadless` browser configuration.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: decrease karma timeouts for local browsers" (#15540)

Issues.Title: CdkVirtualScrollViewport content offset resets on scroll
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Manually set offset by setRenderedContentOffset should not go back to 0 on scroll

#### What is the current behavior?
Scrolling resets offset which is perceived as a jump

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-egcu9t
just click on "set offset to 200", see applied offset and then try to scroll

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I'm using this feature to create date picker similar to one in kendo(https://www.telerik.com/kendo-angular-ui/components/dateinputs/calendar/)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
material 7.3.x

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Here's the responsible code:
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/cdk/scrolling/fixed-size-virtual-scroll.ts#L81
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/cdk/scrolling/fixed-size-virtual-scroll.ts#L149

As I got from the debugger, newRange.start is always 0, and it's seen from line 81 the function executes on scroll
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CdkVirtualScrollViewport content offset resets on scroll " (#15538)
